docs.abstract: The bank reported its first quarterly loss since 2011, because of a one-time hit from the tax law and plunging revenue from trading bonds and other products.
docs.snippet: The bank reported its first quarterly loss since 2011, because of a one-time hit from the tax law and plunging revenue from trading bonds and other products.
docs.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs used to seem invincible. In the fourth quarter, it lost money.

headline.main: Goldman Sachs Once Looked Invincible. Now It’s Losing Money.
headline.print_headline: Weak Results For Goldman Show Depth Of Its Fall

docs.abstract: Many Americans are financially connected to the firearms industry through retirement plans or index funds that own stocks in gun companies.
docs.snippet: Many Americans are financially connected to the firearms industry through retirement plans or index funds that own stocks in gun companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: You probably are a gun owner.

headline.main: You Might Be Giving Gun Companies Money, Even if You Don’t Own a Gun
headline.print_headline: You May Own Guns, Even if You’ve Never Fired a Single Round

byline.original: By Landon Thomas Jr. and Stephen Grocer

docs.abstract: Two retail chains, REI and Mountain Equipment, have suspended orders for items like bike helmets and water bottles from Vista Outdoor because it also makes assault-style rifles.
docs.snippet: Two retail chains, REI and Mountain Equipment, have suspended orders for items like bike helmets and water bottles from Vista Outdoor because it also makes assault-style rifles.
docs.lead_paragraph: The national debate over gun control is now sweeping up bike helmets and water bottles.

headline.main: Gun Control Debate Sweeps Up an Outdoor Brand’s Other Products
headline.print_headline: Not Just Firearms, but Helmets and Bottles, Too

docs.abstract: Rich and technologically advanced, the United States continues to accept a degree of dysfunction that would be intolerable in any other rich society.
docs.snippet: Rich and technologically advanced, the United States continues to accept a degree of dysfunction that would be intolerable in any other rich society.
docs.lead_paragraph: When I wrote my first Economic Scene column six years ago, the unemployment rate languished at 8.2 percent as the job market painfully recovered from the jolt of the Great Recession. By last month, only 3.9 percent of working-age Americans who sought a job didn’t have one.

headline.main: The Profound Social Cost of American Exceptionalism
headline.print_headline: American Exceptionalism Comes With a Social Cost

docs.abstract: The factory will employ 2,500 new workers, the automaker said, adding that it would also award bonuses to each of its 60,000 workers in the United States.
docs.snippet: The factory will employ 2,500 new workers, the automaker said, adding that it would also award bonuses to each of its 60,000 workers in the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles said on Thursday that it planned to spend $1 billion to move production of heavy-duty pickup trucks from Mexico to a factory in Michigan, where it will add 2,500 new jobs as a result.

headline.main: Fiat Chrysler to Spend $1 Billion to Modernize Michigan Plant
headline.print_headline: Fiat Chrysler Credits Tax Cut in Move of Pickup Factory From Mexico to Michigan

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks

docs.abstract: Blackstone may think of itself as a disruptive investor, but its approach to succession planning is anything but.
docs.snippet: Blackstone may think of itself as a disruptive investor, but its approach to succession planning is anything but.
docs.lead_paragraph: Blackstone may think of itself as a disruptive investor, but its approach to succession planning is anything but. The giant alternative-investment manager named the head of its real estate business, Jon Gray, as its day-to-day manager on Tuesday, shunting Tony James into a vice chairman role. Big questions — like whether to remain a partnership — will still sit with the chief executive and co-founder, Steve Schwarzman. Blackstone isn’t run for outsiders’ benefit, and the gradual approach to change shows it.

headline.main: Blackstone Gives Investors Continuity, Whether They Wanted It or Not

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania

docs.abstract: The company cited the new tax law in announcing better pay and benefits, immersing itself in the partisan debate over tax policy. Then it closed 63 stores.
docs.snippet: The company cited the new tax law in announcing better pay and benefits, immersing itself in the partisan debate over tax policy. Then it closed 63 stores.
docs.lead_paragraph: Walmart, the nation’s largest private employer, waded into the bumpy waters of partisan politics on Thursday, announcing that it will use some of its savings under the new tax bill to provide wage increases, bonuses and expanded benefits to its hourly workers.

headline.main: Walmart’s Bumpy Day: From Wage Increase to Store Closings

docs.abstract: The real key to increasing Qualcomm’s value is mending its rift with Apple, not coming up with a buyout.
docs.snippet: The real key to increasing Qualcomm’s value is mending its rift with Apple, not coming up with a buyout.
docs.lead_paragraph: Call it cheeky, sentimental or delusional, but Paul Jacobs’s idea of making an offer for Qualcomm, the company he chaired until this month, is certainly daring. The chip maker only just wiggled out from under a takeover offer from rival Broadcom. What Qualcomm really needs is less a buyer and more a mediator.

headline.main: Qualcomm Needs a Mediator More Than a Buyer

docs.abstract: The president calls the paper, which is owned by Amazon’s chief executive, Jeff Bezos, “a lobbyist weapon,” among other things. “There isn’t anybody here who is paid by Amazon,” the editor, Martin Baron, said.
docs.snippet: The president calls the paper, which is owned by Amazon’s chief executive, Jeff Bezos, “a lobbyist weapon,” among other things. “There isn’t anybody here who is paid by Amazon,” the editor, Martin Baron, said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon does not own The Washington Post. President Trump, however — impervious to certain facts and armed with a Twitter account — has tried hard to convince the public otherwise.

headline.main: To Trump, It’s the ‘Amazon Washington Post.’ To Its Editor, That’s Baloney.
headline.print_headline: Trump Ties The Washington Post To Amazon. Its Editor Is Puzzled.

docs.abstract: But it’s not as easy as it used to be. “The viewer is desensitized,” Mr. Darnell says. “It’s much, much, much harder to get people’s attention.”
docs.snippet: But it’s not as easy as it used to be. “The viewer is desensitized,” Mr. Darnell says. “It’s much, much, much harder to get people’s attention.”
docs.lead_paragraph: BURBANK, Calif. — If he really wanted to, Mike Darnell could probably cast himself in one of the many shows he oversees as the head of unscripted programming at Warner Bros.

headline.main: Reality TV Kingpin Mike Darnell Wants One More Hit
headline.print_headline: In a Crowd, Seeking One More Hit
